Very good example of my points:
More 'personal' claims. 
More attacks on th=
e person with a different opinion (hard hearted, close minded, etc)
And sti=
ll, no addressing the problems of lack of credible evidence.
The problem th=
at noise can 'sound like something', but that doesn't make it from spirits.=

The problem of claims of predictions, but no predictions.

Nicely done.


=

 Well, for me, I am satisfied, t=
hey do not need to prove anything more to me, I have already received all t=
he convincing I need, I spoke to my mother many times in spirit, hearing he=
r voice, not to mention many other people I know personally, I feel bad for=
 folks who are so materialistic that they cannot see any further than the o=
ld brick wall surrounding them, even if one should knock it down these type=
 of people then question if they ever saw the wall to begin with, their min=
d's are so closed, the hearts so hardened. My motto is something more like =
this statement, it's only with the heart that one can see clearly, what's e=
ssential is invisible to the eye, no matter what a person might demonstrate=
 to such a skeptic would not convince them, so it's best you live in your w=
orld, and I will stay in mine.=C2=A0 And to each is own, sf ps. i like to u=
se the colors because that's what they are there for. :)

es about things in the past are not testable predictions, and continue to s=
uggest this is all just radio snippets that people claim are spirits, but h=
ave nothing to justify that claim.=C2=A0 



Like I said, post a prediction=
 for everyone to hear, before it happens, with specific dates and details.=
=C2=A0 If it happens, I would expect to be more interested that this is not=
 just random radio. But, when it doesn't happen, it makes me wonder why peo=
ple still claim it's spirits, but they must be lying. :-)

n that you believe. It means nothing    else.

posed to happen, with a date it is    supposed to happen, and exactly what =
is to happen, of course.

tuff from Frank on 2012. So we can skip    those. We can measure that valid=
ity of that in 2012.

> Actually, it's more interesting than that.    Not only do=
 you not control 

> what the 'spirits' say, you also don't    control what=
 broadcast radio says, 

> and to a large extent you don't    control what =
your brain finds and interprets 

> in the noise you are    hearing.

> 

>=
 I listened to these (trying not to look at the    labels, since once a 

>=
 person looks at the labels, they prime their    brains to interpret the so=
unds in 

> YOUR way, not their own way). To    me, they were either just a=
 mess of 

> random radio snippets, exactly    what you'd expect if a 3 yea=
r old were randomly 

> twisting the radio    dial, or they were just noise=
. Nothing paranormal in 

> the    least.

> 

> I think your instinct to s=
top posting this stuff might    have been a good 

> one. I suspect you are=
 feeling a bit overwhelmed    with this field right now, 

> and it may be =
something is nagging at you    inside someplace, saying it is a 

> waste o=
f your time or a burden on    your life and health, or that you just 

> ne=
ed a little more space for a    while.

> 

> In any case, I'd recommend a =
break: take a nice month    off. See how you 

> feel being away from all t=
his for a while. Come back    fresh if you feel ok 

> after that. But if y=
ou feel obsessed when away,    it might be good to ask 

> your friends and=
 loved ones for some opinions    on what they see in you. Your 

> health i=
s more important than anything    here anyways, and you can't really 

> do=
 a job with interpretation of    your results, much less your other 

> res=
ponsibilities in life, unless    you put your health first.

>
